i have no idea, but u can try

item.title: How do you send packets?
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

[quote=“blah bah7, post:7, topic:122802”][quote author=pizza pie link=topic=172531.msg1593792#msg1593792 date=1184362260]
sry to be the noob but what needs to be imported?
[/quote]

whats the api for :)[br][size=1]Posted on: July 13, 2007, 10:51:59 AM[/size][hr][quote author=pplsuqbawlz link=topic=172531.msg1593678#msg1593678 date=1184360923]

ByteArrayOutputStream b = new ByteArrayOutputStream(); DataOutputStream d = new DataOutputStream(b); d.writeInt(0x43110); // write hello d.writeShort(0x473); // write bye d.writeByte(0x0); // Kill switch? d.close(); b.close(); Socket s; OutputStream o = s.getOutputStream(); o.write(b.toByteArray()); o.flush();

So in essence, it sends the queued data in the output stream.
[/quote]

what does this mean 0x43110?

i also dont get how im supposed to use it, i cant write d.writeInt(jTextArea1.getText()); so how would i do something like that?[/quote]How about you actually try to learn the difference between a String and an int?

Read full topic

item.title: How do you send packets?
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

ByteArrayOutputStream b = new ByteArrayOutputStream(); DataOutputStream d = new DataOutputStream(b); d.writeInt(0x43110); // write hello d.writeShort(0x473); // write bye d.writeByte(0x0); // Kill switch? d.close(); b.close(); Socket s; OutputStream o = s.getOutputStream(); o.write(b.toByteArray()); o.flush();

So in essence, it sends the queued data in the output stream.

item.title: How do you send packets?
item.dc:creator: @semaphore semaphore
item.description:
@semaphore wrote:

Be less specific.

There are no less than 6 definitions for that word.

Using the context of this forum section, I can assume you mean game packets. If that be the case, you wouldn’t understand the answer even if it were spoon fed to you.

What exactly do you want to know? Sending packets is as simple as calling the write method on the outputstream of your choice passing as parameters the byte[] data, start index, and length.

Read full topic
